author: BNerd

text: I agree. Earthbound seemed extremly light hearted but after knowing the truth about Giygas, you begin to realize EVERYTHING that was hidden in Earthbound, all the darkness and despair that it cleverly hid. While Mother 3 it is extremly clear how emotional the game is. Alot of the main cast almost or does die before the game ends! Honestly I almost cried after the Final Boss. Everyone made massive sacrifices to pull the final needle. Mother 3 is more emotional & dramatic and its clear about it.
author: Scarlet Haze

text:
Scarlet Haze So basically... Earthbound is more subtle?

Yeah that's why I think it's better actually, thanks!
author: HylianBelmont

text:
True, it still has darker undertones, but it takes itself much less seriously than Mother 3 does. The final battle is pretty dark and morbid, and really gives you a sick feeling inside, but it more than makes up for it with the humor. Even Itoi has stated that he was going for a more dramatic feel with Mother 3. Hell, the Japanese commercial shows a girl crying! 

But yeah, I get what you mean.
author: Danithak

text: Earthbound is a much more lighthearted game, and it's also a lot more expansive. You spend a lot more time in each individual zone than you ever will in Mother 3. That being said, they're both excellent games.
author: Danithak
